reviewText: Convoluted and funny storyline with a bevy of beauties to complement Dean on this romp thrrough Rome.  Walter Slezak does a bang-up job as a frustrated father and Anna Marie and Eva play his lovesick daughters perfectly...the outcome is somewhat unexpected so I won't spoil it...good, clean fun.
summary: Dino is slick and the girls delicious

reviewText: Dean Martin's first screen venture minus Jerry Lewis nearly killed his movie career. In all fairness, there's nothing wrong with "Ten Thousand Bedrooms" (1957) that a tighter script and some decent songs might have cured. However, the MGM gloss cannot prop up weak material. Richard Thorpe directs a likable cast in glum fashion. Fortunately, Dino's comeback was just around the corner with "The Young Lions" (1958).
Title: N/A

reviewText: A generic piece of 50s glossy CinemaScope fluff that should be monotonous but miraculously is quite pleasant. In his first film after the Martin & Lewis break up, Dean Martin stars as an American millionaire in Rome who falls in love with the youngest daughter (Anna Maria Alberghetti) out of four daughters. When he requests her hand in marriage, he's (predictably) told that the three eldest daughters must be married first. You can pretty well write what happens next yourself. It's more of a romance with music than a musical but what songs there are are pretty inferior. Walter Slezak is the father, the other daughters are the marvelous Eva Bartok (CRIMSON PIRATE), Lisa Gaye and Lisa Montell. The male suitors for the girls are Dewey Martin, Paul Henreid, Steve Dunne and John Archer. Dean Jones, Jules Munshin, Evelyn Varden and Marcel Dalio co-star.The Warners Archive MOD is a nice anamorphic wide screen (2.35 CinemaScope) transfer.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dean Martin and Anna make a cute couple in Italy with lots of Italian fare and Dino singing.  Plot is very thin but I think this was made to show off Dean and Anna especially since Anna Marie was new to the movie.  Enjoy it for what it is "a pleasant "G" musical set in Italy.
summary: Perfect Dino combine with Anna and Rome it's hard not to like
